Stop running get-ansible-role-requirements with -vvv

It generates a lot of console spam and adds very little value to
clone the roles with verbose every time.

subject: Clean imports in code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 05:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/redirect.py'], 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I7766149b0b74b745f73cd26f6f2352042b0ab570
'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I7766149b0b74b745f73cd26f6f2352042b0ab570

subject: make the --reqs arg to project-requirements-change.py useful
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-27 20:13:27.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/files/project-requirements-change.py'], 'message': 'make the --reqs arg to project-requirements-change.py useful

The --reqs argument was not being used which made it difficult to run
the script locally to test it.

This change passes the directory given to --reqs as the requirements
repository directory so that in local mode the repository can live
anywhere.

The default is still set to the location used on the CI nodes.

Change-Id: Id812628345313b781d65140bb3c25adf1eb00bc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
make the --reqs arg to project-requirements-change.py useful

The --reqs argument was not being used which made it difficult to run
the script locally to test it.

This change passes the directory given to --reqs as the requirements
repository directory so that in local mode the repository can live
anywhere.

The default is still set to the location used on the CI nodes.

Change-Id: Id812628345313b781d65140bb3c25adf1eb00bc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 09:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/kubernetes/kube/base.py', 'contrib/kubernetes/kube/worker.py'], 'message': "Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error

kubernetes auth use 'user' and 'project' create context,
but the parameter was modify 'user_id' and 'project_id'.
So, the database get data auth faild.

Change-Id: I366aee582ece6291494b04329f2f14e4491edc0a
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error

kubernetes auth use 'user' and 'project' create context,
but the parameter was modify 'user_id' and 'project_id'.
So, the database get data auth faild.

Change-Id: I366aee582ece6291494b04329f2f14e4491edc0a
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

revisions:

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I72fd5f8c87133713cd272de210b7e957880f48f9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-12 12:58:15.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/services/l3/l3_midonet.py'], 'message': "use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85 and will be
consumed in neutron via I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's multiprovidernet
API definition rather than neutron's extension.

Change-Id: I17350e143beb8ff1cc4ea80b48caa9f9b080cdb3
"}]
commit_message:
use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85 and will be
consumed in neutron via I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's multiprovidernet
API definition rather than neutron's extension.

Change-Id: I17350e143beb8ff1cc4ea80b48caa9f9b080cdb3

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-27 00:51:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/compute-install-ubuntu.rst'], 'message': 'install-guide: add steps to configure rootwrap

We need to configure rootwrap to start privsep daemon that is
used to execute privilege commands. Otherwise, all the shell
commands are not going to work.

Related-Bug: #1749342
Change-Id: I91e55f292e1ae247081e5728df70da81207e44b8

commit_message:
install-guide: add steps to configure rootwrap

We need to configure rootwrap to start privsep daemon that is
used to execute privilege commands. Otherwise, all the shell
commands are not going to work.

Related-Bug: #1749342
Change-Id: I91e55f292e1ae247081e5728df70da81207e44b8

commit_message:
install-guide: add steps to configure rootwrap

We need to configure rootwrap to start privsep daemon that is
used to execute privilege commands. Otherwise, all the shell
commands are not going to work.

Related-Bug: #1749342
Change-Id: I91e55f292e1ae247081e5728df70da81207e44b8

subject: Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-03-27 22:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py'], 'message': 'Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation

This adds functools.wraps [0] to rbac_rule_validation decorator.
"This takes a function used in a decorator and adds the functionality
of copying over the function name, docstring, arguments list, etc." which
is quite convenient [1].

Also stops adding the role as a testcase attribute which can cause
filtering issues via regular expressions when the role doesn't match
the role in tempest.conf under ``[patrole].rbac_test_role``.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps
[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Change-Id: I8fde00e4f9332ba9b9ea94edc714d87ab9e1b851
'}]
commit_message:
Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation

This adds functools.wraps [0] to rbac_rule_validation decorator.
"This takes a function used in a decorator and adds the functionality
of copying over the function name, docstring, arguments list, etc." which
is quite convenient [1].

Also stops adding the role as a testcase attribute which can cause
filtering issues via regular expressions when the role doesn't match
the role in tempest.conf under ``[patrole].rbac_test_role``.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps
[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Change-Id: I8fde00e4f9332ba9b9ea94edc714d87ab9e1b851

hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value

commit_message:
add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674

commit_message:
Fix nova profile get old image attribute

When nova profile execute update_image operation, the
old_image use profile image attribute.

However, the image of nova server does not guarantee that
it has not been modified by other components. So, the
old_image it should be the image attribute contained in server.

Change-Id: If68c54e67fccb3ec186831aa578f45a11007357d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Non-unique network names in Servers IPs API response

Report correct server IP information when multiple networks
with the same name are used in VM. This spec proposes to
group VM networks using their IDs rater than names in
Server IPs API resource.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint servers-ips-non-unique-network-names

Partial-Bug: #1708316
Change-Id: I1b13ed3bfc647b1b85e1535bc17c06bde0fe0d24
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

It is possible to assign a serial number to virtual hard disks which
can be queried by the guest operating system. We currently do this for

Previously-approved: Queens

Change-Id: I6f11e0344db78b9bd9e7406dfd07ab2e3f06eddf

commit_message:
Add serial numbers for local disks

It is possible to assign a serial number to virtual hard disks which
can be queried by the guest operating system. We currently do this for
attached volumes, but we don't do it for local disks: local root
disks, ephemerals, or swap disks.

Previously-approved: Queens
Blueprint: local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I6f11e0344db78b9bd9e7406dfd07ab2e3f06eddf

commit_message:
Don't inform root about FOUND shard ranges

There is no need to tell the root container about shard ranges that
have been newly found. The root is not interested in ranges until
their shard containers have been created.

Change-Id: I1b76095108799566e31804c9a17b16e92f19e0f6

subject: Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-26 13:30:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable

Before, ContainerBroker.find_shard_ranges assumed that any existing
shard ranges had same size as the shard_size passed to the current
invocation of the method when estimating progress.  This could lead to
undesirable results if different shard sizes were used for different
invocation, particularly if the shard size increased to make the
progress appear larger than reality.

With this patch the estimate of progress is based on the actual sizes
of previously found shard ranges. For this to be accurate, previously
found ranges must have remained in FOUND state i.e. no shard container
has yet been created and no newer object updates made to the
shards. If this is not true then the progress estimate is considered
unreliable and defaults to zero.

A TODO is removed which suggested that the object_count might be
refreshed before processing each found range upper. This does not seem
necessary because find_shard_ranges() is called after container has
moved to SHARDING state such that the db being scanned is effectively
'read-only'.

Change-Id: Ib74e2efc4e854a2dd95101777bca114a7865fba7
"}]
commit_message:
Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable

Before, ContainerBroker.find_shard_ranges assumed that any existing
shard ranges had same size as the shard_size passed to the current
invocation of the method when estimating progress.  This could lead to
undesirable results if different shard sizes were used for different
invocation, particularly if the shard size increased to make the
progress appear larger than reality.

With this patch the estimate of progress is based on the actual sizes
of previously found shard ranges. For this to be accurate, previously
found ranges must have remained in FOUND state i.e. no shard container
has yet been created and no newer object updates made to the
shards. If this is not true then the progress estimate is considered
unreliable and defaults to zero.

A TODO is removed which suggested that the object_count might be
refreshed before processing each found range upper. This does not seem
necessary because find_shard_ranges() is called after container has
moved to SHARDING state such that the db being scanned is effectively
'read-only'.

Change-Id: Ib74e2efc4e854a2dd95101777bca114a7865fba7

subject: Stop passing own_shard_range to _misplaced_objects
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-25 12:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': 'Stop passing own_shard_range to _misplaced_objects

Move toward a consistent interface to the methods that implement each
phase of sharding i.e. just pass in a ContainerBroker instance.

The change also avoids any potential for a stale copy of
own_shard_range to be used in _misplaced_objects.

Furthermore, the change simplifies testing. It is no longer necessary
to create an own shard range instance simply to pass it to
_misplaced_objects() in tests.

There was previously some efficiency gained from fetching a single
instance of own_shard_range which was passed to _misplaced_objects and
used to evaluate the state of the sharding process. This is traded off
for the advantages described above.

Change-Id: I96ec8a06c859d49823ec97314011694eac87cb16
'}]
commit_message:
Stop passing own_shard_range to _misplaced_objects

Move toward a consistent interface to the methods that implement each
phase of sharding i.e. just pass in a ContainerBroker instance.

The change also avoids any potential for a stale copy of
own_shard_range to be used in _misplaced_objects.

Furthermore, the change simplifies testing. It is no longer necessary
to create an own shard range instance simply to pass it to
_misplaced_objects() in tests.

There was previously some efficiency gained from fetching a single
instance of own_shard_range which was passed to _misplaced_objects and
used to evaluate the state of the sharding process. This is traded off
for the advantages described above.

Change-Id: I96ec8a06c859d49823ec97314011694eac87cb16

subject: Remove setting of ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 00:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Remove setting of ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL

Adding ETC binaries was a stop gap measure until packages were
available.  With the impending release of bionic that'll be soon :)

Also using the mirror on tarballs.o.o was unreliable so these binaries
are cached in the nodepool images as described in[1].  Having this
setting in d-g makes more work than is needed in the near term.
Removing it does introduce a new failure mode if an etcd version is
used in devstack but not yet cacched in the image.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-March/005871.html

Change-Id: I2a6649ae3094ca65aa31798ee9bddf2fcdd49260
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL

Adding ETC binaries was a stop gap measure until packages were
available.  With the impending release of bionic that'll be soon :)

Also using the mirror on tarballs.o.o was unreliable so these binaries
are cached in the nodepool images as described in[1].  Having this
setting in d-g makes more work than is needed in the near term.
Removing it does introduce a new failure mode if an etcd version is
used in devstack but not yet cacched in the image.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-March/005871.html

Change-Id: I2a6649ae3094ca65aa31798ee9bddf2fcdd49260

subject: Only delete misplaced objects that were moved
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-25 12:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

Before, we read any misplaced objects from a range of the source db,
replicated them, then removed everything in that range from the source
db. Any objects being merged between the read and the removal would be
lost.

With this patch, two safety measures are added:

First, the broker info is sampled before objects are read. The info is
annotated with the db max_row at that moment. Then, when objects are
removed, only rows up to the max row in the sampled broker info are
removed. Any new rows will be retained and dealt with on the next
cycle.  It is possible that new rows were in fact yielded and
replicated, but it is not certain, so they should not be removed. At
worst they will be replicated again on the next cycle and then
removed.

Second, before removing any rows, a check is made that the broker id
has not changed. If it has then no rows are removed.

Also add unit test for ContainerBroker.remove_objects().

Change-Id: I923c257996eb1bfd3aa17895616750461b3aee59
'}]
commit_message:
Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

Before, we read any misplaced objects from a range of the source db,
replicated them, then removed everything in that range from the source
db. Any objects being merged between the read and the removal would be
lost.

With this patch, two safety measures are added:

First, the broker info is sampled before objects are read. The info is
annotated with the db max_row at that moment. Then, when objects are
removed, only rows up to the max row in the sampled broker info are
removed. Any new rows will be retained and dealt with on the next
cycle.  It is possible that new rows were in fact yielded and
replicated, but it is not certain, so they should not be removed. At
worst they will be replicated again on the next cycle and then
removed.

Second, before removing any rows, a check is made that the broker id
has not changed. If it has then no rows are removed.

Also add unit test for ContainerBroker.remove_objects().

Change-Id: I923c257996eb1bfd3aa17895616750461b3aee59

subject: Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-03-25 12:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': "Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range

Before, when cleaving shard ranges, the sharder created local db's for
each shard range and spawned a thread to replicate them. There was no
check that the replication of each db was successful.

Now, each cleaved db is replicated in turn and cleaving does not
progress until each db has been sufficiently replicated. Replication
is considered sufficient if a quorum of replicas were sync'd. If the
sharding node happens to be one of the cleave db's primaries then that
counts as a sync'd replica.

For example, with a 3 replica container ring, replication is
considered sufficient if the cleaved db was sync'd with at least 2
other nodes, or if the cleaved db is on one of it's primaries and also
sync'd with one other node.

Change-Id: I1653ed69c51c9789e2ef19fae762a96a63139766
"}]
commit_message:
Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range

Before, when cleaving shard ranges, the sharder created local db's for
each shard range and spawned a thread to replicate them. There was no
check that the replication of each db was successful.

Now, each cleaved db is replicated in turn and cleaving does not
progress until each db has been sufficiently replicated. Replication
is considered sufficient if a quorum of replicas were sync'd. If the
sharding node happens to be one of the cleave db's primaries then that
counts as a sync'd replica.

For example, with a 3 replica container ring, replication is
considered sufficient if the cleaved db was sync'd with at least 2
other nodes, or if the cleaved db is on one of it's primaries and also
sync'd with one other node.

Change-Id: I1653ed69c51c9789e2ef19fae762a96a63139766

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-03-27 15:12:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/segments/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_segment.py'], 'message': 'Catch Errors When Nova API Microversions Are Not Supported

Currently, errors related to lack of microversion support are completely
masked because of the way eventlet.spawn_n() works. These changes
improve error handling so that deployers are explicitly notified when
Nova API microversions are not supported. This is useful because without
microversion support, the entire flow will break and hosts will not be
associated with segments properly. Deployers will have no idea why
because errors are not printed to log files setup by the standard Python
logging framework.

Related-Bug: #1759004
Change-Id: I9c6151ffa90394612e7f81ededd4a309dd8ab7fb
'}]
commit_message:
Catch Errors When Nova API Microversions Are Not Supported

Currently, errors related to lack of microversion support are completely
masked because of the way eventlet.spawn_n() works. These changes
improve error handling so that deployers are explicitly notified when
Nova API microversions are not supported. This is useful because without
microversion support, the entire flow will break and hosts will not be
associated with segments properly. Deployers will have no idea why
because errors are not printed to log files setup by the standard Python
logging framework.

Related-Bug: #1759004
Change-Id: I9c6151ffa90394612e7f81ededd4a309dd8ab7fb

This reverts commit 7ba9b763828155ba4ec639b92017061b013a2f5f.

correct permissions before the systemd services are started so we

Change-Id: If351f5562a6c0c6ec7404ee2a827772fed32b858
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Create ovs temp directories when using ovs"

This reverts commit 7ba9b763828155ba4ec639b92017061b013a2f5f.

Open vSwitch is creating the /var/run/openvswitch directory with the
correct permissions before the systemd services are started so we
shouldn't have to do that ourselves.

Closes-Bug: #1754139
Change-Id: If351f5562a6c0c6ec7404ee2a827772fed32b858

commit_message:
Set ubuntu-bionic as non-voting on zuul-jobs

This is preventing us from landing code, as since bionic isn't
released yet that is okay since we don't gate any projects.

The bionic issue looks to be around apt cache being stale.

Change-Id: Icfe6b7389f2e91021dca09c5c534448632974e01
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix 'pause' engine command

* Commands going after 'pause' in 'on-XXX' clauses
  were never processed after workflow resume. The
  solution is to introduce a notion of a workflow
  execution backlog where we can save these commands
  in a serialized form so that the engine dispatcher
  could see and process them after resume.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I963b5660daf528d1caf6a785311de4fb272cafd0
Closes-Bug: #1714054

commit_message:
Storwize: check flashcopy_rate before mkfcmap

Configure flashcopy_rate in volume type, there is no value
checking before mkfcmap.

This patch adds flashcopy_rate checking before make fcmap.

Change-Id: I7823749bd8add3ce41e4b2862fd0f06dd0fa0888
Closes-Bug:  1753908

subject: add lower-constraints job

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-23 17:48:37.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'add lower-constraints job

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0ef8ed50f55fa905b6090805a3088fc5ab56906c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
deprecate old general configurations

In order to better support the growing list of
supported configurations we need to prune out the
older less tested configurations in src

Configurations required should be documented and
listed in https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553892/
Change-Id: I56fb4113d4615546ae4fb62e729b262fc985d0d1

subject: Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-26 17:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['monitoring/test/client_tests.py', 'monitoring/test/settings.py', 'monitoring/api/client.py'], 'message': 'Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130
(cherry picked from commit c347cd2bf4f3b3f02e41f07edbf7960ff59110cd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130
(cherry picked from commit c347cd2bf4f3b3f02e41f07edbf7960ff59110cd)

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: Ibc431c82610549171be9f044ac48c4b5f1a50781
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 19:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py'], 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)

subject: Fix integer -> method conversion for python3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-22 18:16:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/plugins/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/auth/plugins/test_core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/auth/plugins/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix integer -> method conversion for python3

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because it
is coded to expect integers when dividing numbers, which is accurate
for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two integers, which
doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth methods. For
example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

This commit introduces unit tests to prevent regression and includes
a fix so that the conversion works properly on python3.

Closes-Bug: 1758121
Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix integer -> method conversion for python3

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because it
is coded to expect integers when dividing numbers, which is accurate
for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two integers, which
doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth methods. For
example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

This commit introduces unit tests to prevent regression and includes
a fix so that the conversion works properly on python3.

Closes-Bug: 1758121
Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa

commit_message:
Switch project neworks.ports to mock

In Python3, map() returns a map object. It is better to ensure to pass
an iterable object when the value is passed to another library.
_construct_parameters in networks/ports/workflows.py is updated.

Change-Id: I471a5620806b0b4e62604cc57dde2485fbdcf242
Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

subject: Make tags filter match subset rather than exact
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-03-27 18:39:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py', 'keystone/resource/backends/sql.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1756190-0e5d86d334555931.yaml'], 'message': 'Make tags filter match subset rather than exact

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches projects that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

This change makes it so that "tags" filtering will be performed by
matching a subset containing given tags against projects, rather than
exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#filtering-and-searching-by-tags

Co-Authored By: Nicolas Helgeson <nh202b@att.com>

Closes-Bug: #1756190
Change-Id: I632efdf0af2969be0a59dc5928a6c036eeca6051
'}]
commit_message:
Make tags filter match subset rather than exact

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches projects that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

This change makes it so that "tags" filtering will be performed by
matching a subset containing given tags against projects, rather than
exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#filtering-and-searching-by-tags

Co-Authored By: Nicolas Helgeson <nh202b@att.com>

Closes-Bug: #1756190
Change-Id: I632efdf0af2969be0a59dc5928a6c036eeca6051

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-22 00:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
'}]
commit_message:
Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425

commit_message:
Correctly set NeutronMl2PluginBase for OVN scenario

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134
(cherry picked from commit e534a7a213294bdf8908addaa3b3da4e070a78dc)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie9af7f8458571e89a91bac8497c3cd8612fdcb35
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Amend the migration paging spec for uuid in server migrations response
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-14 02:16:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/implemented/add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list.rst'], 'message': 'Amend the migration paging spec for uuid in server migrations response

During the review of I7e01f95d7173d9217f76e838b3ea71555151ef56
we made the decision to also add the migration uuid to the server
migrations GET responses to be consistent with the os-migrations
change to add the uuid to the response. This change simply amends
the spec to mention that change as well.

Part of blueprint add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list

Change-Id: Icdd598d34748240a3ed9dade561f8f34857adbc3
'}]
commit_message:
Amend the migration paging spec for uuid in server migrations response

During the review of I7e01f95d7173d9217f76e838b3ea71555151ef56
we made the decision to also add the migration uuid to the server
migrations GET responses to be consistent with the os-migrations
change to add the uuid to the response. This change simply amends
the spec to mention that change as well.

Part of blueprint add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list

Change-Id: Icdd598d34748240a3ed9dade561f8f34857adbc3

commit_message:
Don't assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4

Several places assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4 are set, which
may not be true in ipv6 environments like limestone.  Rework several
of the setup and checks to not assume they are there.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556784
Change-Id: I8cbe78bc127652229917d9e7f531a95f4b6fb0f7

subject: Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-28 01:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', '.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

in those tests.

commit_message:
look at correct branch when determining the sdist name

We need to check out each repository to the hash for the latest
release on the branch to check the sdist name because (a) the name may
change over time and (b) the setup.py file may be removed from master
after a project is retired.

Change-Id: Id207d2ee7e2b70ffad562c7912a0543a4b9f9750
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 13:43:39.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py'], 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 19:00:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/pythonutils.py', 'openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': "more robustly handle error when we can't determine sdist name

Change-Id: Ib6380d997db780ae324a4df61fdfa7f17e4507c3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
more robustly handle error when we can't determine sdist name

Instead of passing None to the service as the sdist name, report that
situation as an error.

Change-Id: Ib6380d997db780ae324a4df61fdfa7f17e4507c3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix parameter error in image_utils

Ref patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514658/

1. Fix parameter error of method fetch_to_volume_format that
   called in fetch_to_raw and fetch_to_vhd.
2. Add new parameter volume_subformat for fetch_to_vhd to keep
   the same business with [Ref patch].

Change-Id: Id30ffd8a40eca841b5d6461c2f0269a0d9a4d628

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-26 17:34:09.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-conntrack-workers-89d303e9ec3b4963.yaml', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_conntrack.py'], 'message': 'Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,

(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)
'}]
commit_message:
Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468
(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)

commit_message:
Fix post up checksum script

The post up checksum script was being executed by the legacy networking
To ensure we retain the same capabilities the checksum fix script has
been moved into a systemd oneshot service.

Change-Id: I58d393eb8c78a541142a29c5e0678cbd6ec18b65
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
remove zmq tests

At the Rocky PTG the Oslo team decided to once again deprecate and
remove the ZMQ driver. This is the first part of doing that, which
removes the unit tests and extra functional test jobs, which are
failing.

Change-Id: Ia02adf122d2d4ff281e7c9fd3dff8894da241925
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from job definition

Given that the parent is the functional job, which already
includes all the required roles, this is unnecessary and
only serves to slow down the test.

Change-Id: Iadcebc9eca9e279ea647a7a35bff5d00f82489f1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-22 08:43:56.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/fluentd.yaml'], 'message': "Fix fluentd upgrade tasks during FFU.

The upgrade task doesn't check for the service existence which make
the upgrade fails during ffu.

We're using the set_facts idiom as it persist between steps.

Closes-Bug: #1757985

Change-Id: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fluentd upgrade tasks during FFU.

The upgrade task doesn't check for the service existence which make
the upgrade fails during ffu.

We're using the set_facts idiom as it persist between steps.

Closes-Bug: #1757985

Change-Id: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-26 21:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)
'}]
commit_message:
Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770
(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)

* The minimum required Cinder API microversion that Nova
  checks for is 3.44.
* The first TODO about disallowing a volume to be attached to
  the same instance multiple times has been resolved by
  change I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187.

commit_message:
Amend volume multi-attach spec

* The minimum required Cinder API microversion that Nova
  checks for is 3.44.
* The first TODO about disallowing a volume to be attached to
  the same instance multiple times has been resolved by
  change I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187.
* The second TODO about adding a new microversion is removed;
  we added microversion 2.60 for multiattach volume support in nova.

Change-Id: I12efa58b95ba1a2f8615256924f4a7a44c354ced

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
"}]
commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower

in those tests.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Idd1779c38f0fcd49130971d4eb2679247af796ce
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Use wait_random_exponential from tenacity 4.4.0

Now that we depend on tenacity >=4.4.0, we can use the library's version of
the wait_random_exponential wait strategy in place of our own.

subject: tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 15:46:29.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_install.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f
(cherry picked from commit 4b940c8337017dcfb275f3eba90f4e8f5fa6dffc)
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f
(cherry picked from commit 4b940c8337017dcfb275f3eba90f4e8f5fa6dffc)

commit_message:

Tempest is timing out in the tripleo promotion jobs.
Let's see if bumping the workers from 2 to 3 speeds
it up enough and if it stays reliable.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-22 16:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': "Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-22 22:46:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat_docker_agent/configure_container.sh'], 'message': 'Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iec6e055c97a440ac62ea684fe0130a4f53ed27bb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553063
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Avoid tox-install.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-14 20:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: Ib7d66460c21e3dbcf2d55d7ecac23315daa65ec7
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: Ib7d66460c21e3dbcf2d55d7ecac23315daa65ec7

commit_message:
Share overcloud Heat templates for undercloud conf

Now that we have --use-heat mode by default, allow
to alter the default location of tripleo heat templates for
undercloud as well.

Move related cleanup and output dir to the expected DEFAULT
namespace.

Related-bug: #1749683
Change-Id: I050c09c4447fa45dd6e82dc3199bec60b1a10696
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Since a5b920a external instance event routing is
done by checking migration_context for instance.
The problem here is that claims aren't used for
live-migration yet, and no migration_context is created.

This patch fixes this problem by explicitly creating
migration_context on conductor's side, to ensure routing will
work properly.

While this change is a hotfix the rationale for doing that it's

commit_message:
Create migration context for live-migration

Since a5b920a external instance event routing is
done by checking migration_context for instance.
The problem here is that claims aren't used for
live-migration yet, and no migration_context is created.

This patch fixes this problem by explicitly creating
migration_context on conductor's side, to ensure routing will
work properly.

While this change is a hotfix the rationale for doing that it's
backportable nature.

Change-Id: Id4d3e856c33d16fe80af46aa3c3f6edb77ab2269
Related-Bug: #1414559

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-22 11:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml'], 'message': "Allow stacks to remove old update resources

Change I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f removed old
update-related resources, but it seems that we need to do such removal
in two steps to allow smooth transition for existing stacks: first
remove them from the stack, and only then completely remove the
mapping from resource registry. If we try to do both at the same time,
we get:

ERROR: The Resource Type (OS::TripleO::Tasks::UpdateWorkflow) could
not be found.

So we'll need to keep these resource registry entries around (even
though mapped to OS::Heat::None) for the Rocky cycle still. They can
be removed in S.

Change-Id: I866e659bd373dfb2816508165b7f3abb9580e2d0
Closes-Bug: #1758014
"}]
commit_message:
Allow stacks to remove old update resources

Change I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f removed old
update-related resources, but it seems that we need to do such removal
in two steps to allow smooth transition for existing stacks: first
remove them from the stack, and only then completely remove the
mapping from resource registry. If we try to do both at the same time,
we get:

ERROR: The Resource Type (OS::TripleO::Tasks::UpdateWorkflow) could
not be found.

So we'll need to keep these resource registry entries around (even
though mapped to OS::Heat::None) for the Rocky cycle still. They can
be removed in S.

Change-Id: I866e659bd373dfb2816508165b7f3abb9580e2d0
Closes-Bug: #1758014

commit_message:
Amend the "add extra-specs to flavor" for create and update API

1. The response of ``POST /flavors`` and ``PUT /flavors/{flavor_id}``
also needs to add the ``extra-specs`` in response to keep consist.
2. Fix typo in bp.
3. Change primary assignee and other contributors.

Part of blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I2d2523da038e5f4e5547eb74180786429e817912

subject: Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 08:59:10.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/database/mysql.yaml'], 'message': 'Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA

During major upgrade of non-HA overcloud, paunch stops the
containerized mysql service, update container image and restart
the containerized mysql.

After a major update of mysql (e.g. 5.5 to 10.0), run mysql_upgrade
to ensure that database on-disk is upgraded to match the mysql
server version (e.g. update all MyISAM tables)

The mysql_upgrade cannot be performed during upgrade_steps because
paunch only runs during the deploy_steps. So run it in the
post_upgrade_steps, once we know paunch has updated mysql.

Change-Id: I6b6a531fd716ad9abcbf29886c0b1f2c64f04c9d
(cherry picked from commit 02f860916897bfa29392f4d2ebaef83d5bef3adb)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA

During major upgrade of non-HA overcloud, paunch stops the
containerized mysql service, update container image and restart
the containerized mysql.

After a major update of mysql (e.g. 5.5 to 10.0), run mysql_upgrade
to ensure that database on-disk is upgraded to match the mysql
server version (e.g. update all MyISAM tables)

The mysql_upgrade cannot be performed during upgrade_steps because
paunch only runs during the deploy_steps. So run it in the
post_upgrade_steps, once we know paunch has updated mysql.

Change-Id: I6b6a531fd716ad9abcbf29886c0b1f2c64f04c9d
(cherry picked from commit 02f860916897bfa29392f4d2ebaef83d5bef3adb)

subject: Remove the sql token driver and uuid token provider
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-12 17:43:41.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/token/persistence/backends/sql.py', 'doc/source/admin/token-provider.rst', 'keystone/token/persistence/__init__.py', 'keystone/token/providers/uuid.py', 'keystone/token/__init__.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_uuid_provider.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py', 'keystone/token/persistence/backends/__init__.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py', 'keystone/token/persistence/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_revoke.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'doc/source/admin/token-support-matrix.ini', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py', 'releasenotes/notes/removed-as-of-rocky-f44c3ba7c3e73d01.yaml', 'keystone/server/backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_backends.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove the sql token driver and uuid token provider

Both of these drivers were staged for removal in Rocky. Now that
Rocky is open for development we can remove them. This commit removes
just the bare-bones aspects of each. Subsequent patches will do the
following:

  - Remove test class that were only meant for sql or uuid scenarios
  - Refactor the notification framework to not hint at token storage
  - Refactor the token provider API interfaces to be simpler and
    cleaner
  - Remove the needs_persistence property from the token provider API
    and document the ability to push that logic into individual
    providers that require it
  - Return 403 Forbidden for all requests to fetch a revocation list
  - Remove the signing directory configuration options

These changes will result in simpler interfaces which will be
important for people implementing their own token providers and
storage layers.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: I76d5c29f6b1572ee3ec7f2b1af63ff31572de2ce
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the sql token driver and uuid token provider

Both of these drivers were staged for removal in Rocky. Now that
Rocky is open for development we can remove them. This commit removes
just the bare-bones aspects of each. Subsequent patches will do the
following:

  - Remove test class that were only meant for sql or uuid scenarios
  - Refactor the notification framework to not hint at token storage
  - Refactor the token provider API interfaces to be simpler and
    cleaner
  - Remove the needs_persistence property from the token provider API
    and document the ability to push that logic into individual
    providers that require it
  - Return 403 Forbidden for all requests to fetch a revocation list
  - Remove the signing directory configuration options

These changes will result in simpler interfaces which will be
important for people implementing their own token providers and
storage layers.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: I76d5c29f6b1572ee3ec7f2b1af63ff31572de2ce

subject: Few correction in the server filter/sort spec
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-27 16:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/implemented/add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst'], 'message': "Few correction in the server filter/sort spec

server filter/sort spec (add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst)
is implemented in ocata but there are 'all_tenants' behavior
and policy changes mentioned in this spec which actually did not get
implemented.

Those proposed changes were rediscussed in API meeting [1] to implement in
a different way [2] which again not completed yet.

There was no consensus on direction that time and need more broad discussion
to make 'all_tenants' bits as better UX.

But anyways we should cleanup the implemented spec with things
not yet done. Otherwise people might get wrong impressions about 'all_tenants'
changes.

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params which are implemented in schema but missing in
spec's whitelist:
 - Add 'created_at' and 'changes-since' in filter params list
 - Add 'created_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. Remove the 'all_tenants' proposed changes which are not implemented yet.

We will further discuss/plan the 'all_tenants' proposal as fresh spec.

.. 1 http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html
.. 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425533/

Change-Id: Ibdcc5cae3b73c0aa0d3e0a785c827682df0483ca
"}]
commit_message:
Few correction in the server filter/sort spec

server filter/sort spec (add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst)
is implemented in ocata but there are 'all_tenants' behavior
and policy changes mentioned in this spec which actually did not get
implemented.

Those proposed changes were rediscussed in API meeting [1] to implement in
a different way [2] which again not completed yet.

There was no consensus on direction that time and need more broad discussion
to make 'all_tenants' bits as better UX.

But anyways we should cleanup the implemented spec with things
not yet done. Otherwise people might get wrong impressions about 'all_tenants'
changes.

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params which are implemented in schema but missing in
spec's whitelist:
 - Add 'created_at' and 'changes-since' in filter params list
 - Add 'created_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. Remove the 'all_tenants' proposed changes which are not implemented yet.

We will further discuss/plan the 'all_tenants' proposal as fresh spec.

.. 1 http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html
.. 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425533/

Change-Id: Ibdcc5cae3b73c0aa0d3e0a785c827682df0483ca

commit_message:

subject: Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 17:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/use-service-catalog-for-endpoints.rst'], 'message': "Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7
"}]
commit_message:
Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-26 07:58:41.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst'], 'message': "Few updates on server filter/sort spec

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params are missing in spec's whitelist:
 -  Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list
 -  Add 'creacted_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. all_tenant Rule(old or new) should not change the API behvaiour
   Making new rule soft enforcement(no 403) actually changes the API
   behaviour and can break upgrade. This behaviour changes needs
   version bump.
   Details: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html

commit_message:
Few updates on server filter/sort spec

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params are missing in spec's whitelist:
 -  Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list
 -  Add 'creacted_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. all_tenant Rule(old or new) should not change the API behvaiour
   Making new rule soft enforcement(no 403) actually changes the API
   behaviour and can break upgrade. This behaviour changes needs
   version bump.
   Details: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html

partial implement of bp add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters

Change-Id: I0d51037b99c023d63dc3bef63a9190b498cd87b8

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2115c1c13e609c3f720c44f38f5562cead456373
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
table: Show checkbox only when there is BatchAction

Checkbox in a table assumes BatchAction.
 This commit checks whether at least one BatchAction is
 included as table actions and displays checkboxes
 only when BatchAction is available.

Change-Id: Ia1cba6c59f5d40f7df7f4b98a9f459a6934cfbb7
Closes-Bug: #1744742

subject: Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-05 22:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/__init__.py', 'yaql/standard_library/queries.py', 'yaql/tests/test_queries.py'], 'message': 'Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032
'}]
commit_message:
Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-21 14:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'message': "Fix UpdateLRouterPortCommand to work with OVS 2.8

The UpdateLRouterPortCommand was broken when used with OVS <= 2.8 due
to the ipv6_ra_configs column not existing in the OVNDB schema.

This patch is adding a check on that command to ignore that column if
it's not present. A TODO was left as a comment so we don't forget to
remove this check once the support for older OVS versions are dropped.

Change-Id: I1ce87173731146e3f0078df99b7ba56f44b14497
Closes-Bug: #1757438
"}]
commit_message:
Fix UpdateLRouterPortCommand to work with OVS 2.8

The UpdateLRouterPortCommand was broken when used with OVS <= 2.8 due
to the ipv6_ra_configs column not existing in the OVNDB schema.

This patch is adding a check on that command to ignore that column if
it's not present. A TODO was left as a comment so we don't forget to
remove this check once the support for older OVS versions are dropped.

Change-Id: I1ce87173731146e3f0078df99b7ba56f44b14497
Closes-Bug: #1757438

Load networks and security groups in parallel

We need both networks and security groups info on the port details page.
To speedup page loading we loads this data in parallel using futurist
library

subject: Have run_tests clone the test repo
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-26 17:18:12.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', '.gitignore', 'run_tests_common.sh', 'tox.ini', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Have run_tests clone the test repo

Current run_tests.sh executes another script (tests-repo-clone.sh)
to clone the tests repo. That script therefore has to be replicated
out to all the other repositories too.

In order to try to reduce the footprint of things that need to be
replicated out to the repositories, we fold the tests repo clone
into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for
the previous test repo clone as it does no harm to always have it.

To reduce the maintenance when creating new branches, we key the
branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Some extra comments are added to explain the purpose of variables/
commands and the install_pkg_deps function is changed to just be
in line script as the function is no re-used anywhere else.

We change the set vars in the common script to add x and remove v
to reduce the output verbosity and only output the useful stuff.

Finally, the linters job definition is changed so that it uses
run_tests.sh to execute the lint tests. This simplifies the job
definition and also ensures that zuul runs tests in the same way
that humans do.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839
'}]
commit_message:
Have run_tests clone the test repo

Current run_tests.sh executes another script (tests-repo-clone.sh)
to clone the tests repo. That script therefore has to be replicated
out to all the other repositories too.

In order to try to reduce the footprint of things that need to be
replicated out to the repositories, we fold the tests repo clone
into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for
the previous test repo clone as it does no harm to always have it.

To reduce the maintenance when creating new branches, we key the
branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Some extra comments are added to explain the purpose of variables/
commands and the install_pkg_deps function is changed to just be
in line script as the function is no re-used anywhere else.

We change the set vars in the common script to add x and remove v
to reduce the output verbosity and only output the useful stuff.

Finally, the linters job definition is changed so that it uses
run_tests.sh to execute the lint tests. This simplifies the job
definition and also ensures that zuul runs tests in the same way
that humans do.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I123055f6eb0a653803ac2b574ea6c87bee707256
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034

oslo service replaced by cotyledon.
Motivation:
Oslo service uses eventlet and green threads for timers and threads.
In Vitrage we use real threads and multiprocessing, it seems this 
combination causes unexpected behavior (such as timers not running, 
processes not starting) so the entire solution is very delicate to 
changes.

As part of an ongoing effort (previously, monkeypatching was removed)
this commit solves issues encountered in rpc_collector commit in 
addition it removes unnecessary complications in the application.

Co-Authored-By: Eyal <eyal.bar-ilan@nokia.com>
Change-Id: If33708e128d7aeb420a9aa79f71cfccd2b48dfb3
'}]
commit_message:
refactoring vitrage processes

oslo service replaced by cotyledon.
Motivation:
Oslo service uses eventlet and green threads for timers and threads.
In Vitrage we use real threads and multiprocessing, it seems this 
combination causes unexpected behavior (such as timers not running, 
processes not starting) so the entire solution is very delicate to 
changes.

As part of an ongoing effort (previously, monkeypatching was removed)
this commit solves issues encountered in rpc_collector commit in 
addition it removes unnecessary complications in the application.

Co-Authored-By: Eyal <eyal.bar-ilan@nokia.com>
Change-Id: If33708e128d7aeb420a9aa79f71cfccd2b48dfb3
